Approval(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when the allowance of a `spender` for an `owner` is set by a call to {approve}. `value` is the new allowance.

params.from: The user whose tokens are being transferred
params.index: The new liquidity index of the reserve

params.from: The owner of the aTokens, getting them burned

Initialized(uint8).details: Triggered when the contract has been initialized or reinitialized.

Transfer(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when `value` tokens are moved from one account (`from`) to another (`to`). Note that `value` may be zero.

approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}. NOTE: If `amount` is the maximum `uint256`, the allowance is not updated on `transferFrom`. This is semantically equivalent to an infinite approval. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

availableBalanceOf(address).details: Returns available balance of the user.

returns.result: The available balance of the user

balanceOf(address).details: Caalculates actual 'user' balance on current block. Calculates as 'principal' + 'interest'.

burn(address,uint256,uint256).details: Burns pTokens from `user` and sends the equivalent amount of underlying to `receiverOfUnderlying`

params._amount: The amount of underlying token being returned to receiver
params._user: The owner of the pTokens, getting them burned

decimals().details: Returns the number of decimal places used for token values.

returns._0: The number of decimal places as a uint8.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

getDepositIndexById(uint256).details: Function to get a deposit index in user's deposit array.

getUserLockedBalance(address).details: Returns locked deposits and balance of user

returns._0: Structure with deposits and total locked balance of user

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

params._bucketsFactory: Address of the buckets factory that will call the setBucket fucntion
params._decimals: The number of decimals for the ERC20 token.
params._name: The name of the ERC20 token.
params._symbol: The symbol of the ERC20 token.

lockDeposit(address,uint256,uint256).details: This function can only be called externally and overrides the corresponding function in the parent contract.The user must not be blacklisted.

params._amount: The amount to be locked as a deposit.
params._duration: The duration for which the deposit will be locked.
params._user: The address of the user for whom the deposit is being locked.

params._amount: The amount of tokens getting minted
params._user: The address receiving the minted tokens

mintToReserve(address,uint256,uint256).details: Mints pTokens to the reserve address Compared to the normal mint, we don't revert when the amountScaled is equal to the zero. Additional checks were also removed Only callable by the Bucket

params._amount: The amount of tokens getting minted

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

scaledBalanceOf(address).details: Returns the scaled balance of the user.

returns._0: The scaled balances of the user

scaledTotalSupply().details: Returns the scaled total supply of pToken.

returns._0: The scaled total supply of the pToken.

setBucket(address).details: Sets the bucket for the contract.

params._bucket: The address of the bucket to set.

setInterestIncreaser(address).details: Sets the InterestIncreaser for current PToken.

setLenderRewardDistributor(address).details: Sets the lender reward distributor contract address.

params._lenderRewardDistributor: The address of the lender reward distributor contract.

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

totalSupply().details: Calculates the total supply of the pToken. It increments over blocks mining.

returns._0: The current total supply of the pToken.

transfer(address,uint256).details: Transfers the pTokens from 'msg.sender' to recipient.

params._amount: The amount of pTokens to be transferred. If scpecified amount = type(uint256).max the all tokens of 'msg.sender' will be transferred.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: Transfers the pTokens between 'sender' and 'recipient' using allowance mechanism.

params._amount: The amount of pTokens to be transferred. If scpecified amount = type(uint256).max the all tokens of 'msg.sender' will be transferred.

params._depositId: The ID of the deposit to be unlocked.

lockDeposit(address,uint256,uint256).notice: Locks a deposit for a specified user.
